title: OT125: Opentathlon Thread
summary:
Key ideas:
- This is an open thread in which users can talk about anything, but without discussing hot-button political and social topics.
- The author is trying out Google-style sidebar ads to see how much they make versus how much they annoy people.
- The author is considering implementing a "culture war ban" for users who contribute positively to the community but cannot discuss politics responsibly.

Key learnings:
- Open threads are a way for users to engage with the community without discussing sensitive topics.
- The author is testing new revenue streams.
- The author is actively seeking ways to improve the discussion quality on the blog.

Key questions:
- How can the author best balance revenue generation with user experience?
- How can the author implement a culture war ban without causing more headaches?
- Will users appreciate the opportunity to engage in non-political discourse?
